title: Relationship Between School Facility Quality and Learning Outcomes: Exploratory Study Through Qualitative Case Studies for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of educational psychology, curriculum design principles, and school environment evaluation
context.additional_context: Designed for pre-service teachers to analytically understand the impact of physical educational environments on learning outcomes and develop effective teaching strategies. Targets large-scale online learners, applying content through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze three or more mechanisms explaining how school facility quality impacts learning outcomes.
Learners can describe, through case studies, how school climate mediates the relationship between facility quality and learning outcomes.
Learners can write educational environment evaluation reports by applying qualitative research methods (case studies, observations, photo interviews, etc.).
Learners can propose teacher-led practical strategies for school facility improvements based on analysis results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
